lead_paragraph: Two former top State Street executives were hit with securities fraud charges on Thursday for misleading investors about a risky subprime mortgage-laden fund and tipping off favored clients, Reuters reported.
snippet: Two former top State Street executives were hit with securities fraud charges on Thursday for misleading investors about a risky subprime mortgage-laden fund and tipping off favored clients.

headline.main: S.E.C. Charges Former State Street Executives

abstract: Two former top State Street executives were hit with securities fraud charges on Thursday for misleading investors about a risky subprime mortgage-laden fund and tipping off favored clients.
